name: places/ChIJ0TgvivNZwokRnyK6nNfD5AI
formattedAddress: West 52nd Street &, 6th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: West 52nd Street &, 6th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: My first time in New York and my family told me about the original Halal food truck. Just walking up to the ever going line of customers the aroma of the chicken was phenomenal. There are many other Halal stops but the one on 6th Avenue &, W 53rd St was the best. I ordered the combo plate with lamb and chicken regular size. This included all the vegetables, white sauce, and two lines of spicy sauce. I enjoy spicy food where the spice doesn't over power the food and this sauce hit the spot. Word of caution the spice sauce is hot so don't get too much, one line should be enough. Overall a great experience and a must when visiting New York.

originalText.text: If the halal guys line is too long, this is an alternative gyros chicken rice food stand, which is suited across. Food is ok, and no lines.

text.text: If the halal guys line is too long, this is an alternative gyros chicken rice food stand, which is suited across. Food is ok, and no lines.

originalText.text: I definitely thought this was the halal guys. They are not but it is still good food. The combo platter was great and some of the best halal I’ve had yet in nyc. The sauce is good. The spicy sauce is very spicy but also good. Decent price and quick service. I would eat here again

text.text: I definitely thought this was the halal guys. They are not but it is still good food. The combo platter was great and some of the best halal I’ve had yet in nyc. The sauce is good. The spicy sauce is very spicy but also good. Decent price and quick service. I would eat here again

originalText.text: The cart had a long line every night so we decided to try it.  A little turned off by the guy handling both food and money, but ate anyways, and it was good. I got violently ill the next morning and had to cancel my trip to an observatory due to needing to be by the toilet all day. My husband and I ate the same thing, the only difference was that I put the “white sauce” on mine and he didn’t- and he didn’t get sick. The package said to refrigerate and I can tell you, they were not being stored in any type of cooler/chiller.  I should have walked away when the guy handled food and money with the same gloved hand.  I learned my lesson.

originalText.text:
Hey there! Have you ever been to this super cool food cart on 5th Ave? It's called the Original Halal Cart, and let me tell you, it's amazing! It's like a treasure chest of yummy food right in the middle of the city.

Their chicken and lamb are soooo tasty! They cook it with special spices that make it super yummy. And guess what? They put it on top of this delicious rice that smells so good! It's like a party in your mouth with all the flavors.

The people there are really nice too! They always say hi with big smiles and make you feel happy. Even when there's a big line, they're really fast and make sure everyone gets their food super quickly.

You know what's the best part? It's like being on an adventure when you eat there because the food tastes like it's from far away, in a magical place!

If you ever go to 5th Ave, you should totally check out the Original Halal Cart. It's the yummiest and coolest food place around!
